content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Haoyu Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Hello Haoyu Wang, nice to meet you. I'm glad you like the apartment. As a landlord, I'm looking for the highest price possible for this 50 square meter one-bedroom apartment in the city center. What's your offer?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Given that the apartment is unfurnished and newly built, I would say a fair price would be around 700 euros per month.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Sorry, but I'm looking for a higher price than that. The apartment is located in a prime area, close to all amenities, and it's unfurnished, which means the tenant will have to provide their own furniture and appliances. I believe a fair price would be around 1,000 euros per month. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: Considering the unfurnished state of the apartment and its location, 1,000 euros seems a bit steep. I understand that it's in a good location, but 800 euros would be more reasonable.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I see your point, but I'm afraid I can't go any lower than 900 euros. The apartment is unfurnished, true, but it's also newly built and has all the modern amenities one could ask for. Plus, the location is prime, with everything you need within walking distance. I think 900 euros is a fair price, considering everything you're getting. What do you think?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand your point, and I acknowledge that the apartment has its advantages. However, I'm a student and my budget is limited. I'm willing to go up to 850 euros, but that's the highest I can go.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content:
I understand that you're a student and that your budget is limited. I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. Unfortunately, I'm afraid I can't go any lower than 900 euros. The apartment is a valuable asset, and I can't afford to rent it out for anything less than that.

I'm willing to make some compromises, though. How about this: I'll include some basic furniture and appliances in the rental price? That way, you'll have everything you need to move in and get settled right away. And I'll also throw in a few extra perks, like a free cleaning service once a month and a discount on the rent for the first six months. What do you think? Would that be something you'd be interested in?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
That sounds like a reasonable compromise. If you're willing to include basic furniture and appliances, a free cleaning service, and a discounted rent for the first six months, then I'm willing to pay 900 euros per month.

[yourname], I agree to the price of [900] Euro!
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content:
Great, it's a deal! I'm glad we could come to an agreement. Just to confirm, you'll be paying 900 euros per month for the apartment, and I'll provide the basic furniture and appliances, as well as a free cleaning service once a month for the first six months. You'll also receive a discounted rent for the first six months.

I'll need you to sign a rental agreement and provide a security deposit of 1,800 euros, which will be returned to you at the end of the rental period, provided there's no damage to the apartment.

When would you like to move in? And do you have any questions or concerns before we finalize the rental agreement?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
I plan to move in on the 1st of July. Regarding the security deposit, I understand that it will be returned to me if there's no damage to the apartment. I have no other questions or concerns at the moment.

[yourname], I agree to the price of [900] Euro! 

[/user][yourname], TERMINATE
name: Haoyu Wang from China
